unnormalised: ## Flash Sales: Blink and You'll Miss the Chaadar (and Everything Else!)
normalised: ## Flash Sales: Blink and You'll Miss the Chaadar (and Everything Else!)

unnormalised: Okay, folks, let's talk about flash sales. These things are like the Mumbai local during rush hour – chaotic, intense, and if you're not quick enough, you're left standing on the platform, watching all the fun (and discounted sarees) disappear.
normalised: Okay, folks, let's talk about flash sales. These things are like the Mumbai local during rush hour – chaotic, intense, and if you're not quick enough, you're left standing on the platform, watching all the fun (and discounted sarees) disappear.

unnormalised: I swear, these e-commerce sites think they're doing us a favour. "Limited time offer! Only for the next 2 hours!" My dear, I can barely decide what to have for dinner in 2 hours, let alone choose a new fridge! But the pressure, oh the pressure! It's like your Auntie Sunita breathing down your neck at a wedding, urging you to take more gulab jamun. You know you shouldn't, but… the discount!
normalised: I swear, these e-commerce sites think they're doing us a favour. "Limited time offer! Only for the next two hours!" My dear, I can barely decide what to have for dinner in two hours, let alone choose a new fridge! But the pressure, oh the pressure! It's like your Auntie Sunita breathing down your neck at a wedding, urging you to take more gulab jamun. You know you shouldn't, but… the discount!

unnormalised: And the countdown timers! They’re flashing red, practically screaming at you. It's enough to give you a serious case of FOMO. Suddenly, that pressure cooker you never knew you needed (or even wanted) becomes the most crucial purchase of your life. You imagine yourself, like a culinary queen ala Tarla Dalal, whipping up the most amazing biryani. All because of a measly Rs. 500 discount.
normalised: And the countdown timers! They’re flashing red, practically screaming at you. It's enough to give you a serious case of F O M O. Suddenly, that pressure cooker you never knew you needed (or even wanted) becomes the most crucial purchase of your life. unnormalised: Then comes the heartbreak. You spend 20 minutes entering your address, enduring the eternal wheel of death on the payment gateway, only to be told, "Sorry, item out of stock." Seriously? Was I competing with Ambani himself for this electric kettle?
normalised: Then comes the heartbreak. You spend twenty minutes entering your address, enduring the eternal wheel of death on the payment gateway, only to be told, "Sorry, item out of stock." Seriously? Was I competing with Ambani himself for this electric kettle?

unnormalised: My friend, Priya, once missed a flash sale on a 1,000 sq ft plot of land near Lonavala. She said she was stuck in a traffic jam near Dadar, and by the time she reached a decent internet connection, it was all gone. Now she cries into her chai every time she sees a "Weekend Getaway" ad. Talk about painful!

unnormalised: Dr. Sharma at our colony says it’s a marketing ploy, designed to induce panic buying. He's probably right. But, hey, if I can snag a new kurta for Rs. 200 off, I'm willing to risk the mild anxiety. Just gotta be faster than a speeding auto rickshaw during peak hours. Wish me luck! And remember, blink and you’ll miss the chaadar! Don't say I didn't warn you. Next flash sale on 15-Aug-2024, right?
